BatchSendEmail.document: This API is used to send a TEXT or HTML email to multiple recipients at a time for marketing or notification purposes. By default, you can send emails using a template only. You need to create a recipient group with email addresses first and then send emails by group ID. SES supports scheduled and recurring email sending tasks. You need to pass in `TimedParam` for a scheduled task and `CycleParam` for a recurring one.
BatchSendEmail.name: Sends an email to multiple recipients at a time

CreateAddressUnsubscribeConfig.document: This API is used to create an address-level unsubscribe configuration.
CreateAddressUnsubscribeConfig.name: Create an address-level unsubscribe configuration

CreateEmailAddress.document: After the sender domain is verified, you need a sender address to send emails. For example, if your sender domain is mail.qcloud.com, your sender address can be service@mail.qcloud.com. If you want to display your name (such as "Tencent Cloud") in the inbox list of the recipients, the sender address should be in the format of `Tencent Cloud <email address>`. Please note that there must be a space between your name and the first angle bracket.
CreateEmailAddress.name: Creates a sender address

CreateEmailIdentity.document: This API is used to create a sender domain. Before you can send an email using Tencent Cloud SES, you must create a sender domain as your identity. It can be the domain of your website or mobile app. You must verify the domain to prove that you own it and authorize Tencent Cloud SES to use it to send emails.
CreateEmailIdentity.name: Creates a sender domain

CreateEmailTemplate.document:
This API is used to create a TEXT or HTML email template. To create an HTML template, ensure that it does not include external CSS files. You can use {{variable name}} to specify a variable in the template.
Note: Only an approved template can be used to send emails.
CreateEmailTemplate.name: Creates an email template

CreateReceiver.document: This API is used to create a recipient group, which is the list of target email addresses for batch sending emails. After creating a group, you need to upload recipient email addresses. Then, you can create a sending task and select the group to batch send emails.
CreateReceiver.name: Creates a recipient group

CreateReceiverDetail.document: This API is used to add recipient email addresses (up to 20,000 at a time) to a recipient group. This will be processed asynchronously. If the data volume is large, it may take some time to upload. You can check the recipient group for the upload status and upload quantity. This API has basically the same feature as that of `CreateReceiverDetailWithData` except that it doesn't support uploading template parameters for email sending. You need to first call the `CreateReceiver` API to create a recipient group, then call this API to pass in recipient addresses, and finally call the `BatchSendEmail` API to batch send emails. This API supports adding more recipient addresses during upload but not address deduplication, so you need to make sure that the recipient addresses are not duplicate by yourself. This API can request up to 20,000 recipient addresses at a time, but the recipient group can contain up to 50,000 addresses currently.
CreateReceiverDetail.name: Adds recipient email addresses

CreateReceiverDetailWithData.document: Add recipient addresses with Template parameters. Use this API to import Template parameters while adding recipient addresses, ensuring each recipient address uses Template variables with different values when sending emails. Users first call the CreateReceiver API to create a recipient list, then call this API to import recipient addresses and Template parameters for email sending, and finally use the BatchSendEmail API to complete batch email sending. Notably, after using this API, the Template parameter in the BatchSendEmail API does not need to be passed again. Users can also import recipient addresses, Template variables, and parameter values via the import file option in the console under Email Sending - Recipient List menu. This API limits the number of recipient addresses in a single request to 20,000 entries. It can also append recipient addresses to an already uploaded recipient list, but the total number of recipient addresses in the list must not exceed a certain limit, currently set at 50,000 entries. This API does not support removing duplicate recipient addresses. Users need to ensure uploaded and appended addresses are non-repeating and do not duplicate previously uploaded addresses.
CreateReceiverDetailWithData.name: Add a recipient address and attach template parameters

DeleteBlackList.document: This API is used to unblocklist email addresses. If you confirm that a blocklisted recipient address is valid and active, you can remove it from Tencent Cloud’s address blocklist database.
DeleteBlackList.name: Unblocklists recipient addresses

DeleteCustomBlackList.document: Delete a custom blocklist email address.
DeleteCustomBlackList.name: Delete a custom blocklist

DeleteEmailAddress.document: This API is used to delete a sender address.
DeleteEmailAddress.name: Deletes a sender address

DeleteEmailIdentity.document: This API is used to delete a sender domain. After deleted, the sender domain can no longer be used to send emails.
DeleteEmailIdentity.name: Deletes a sender domain

DeleteEmailTemplate.document: This API is used to delete an email template.
DeleteEmailTemplate.name: Deletes an email template

DeleteReceiver.document: This API is used to delete a recipient group and all recipient email addresses in the group based on the recipient group ID.
DeleteReceiver.name: Deletes a recipient group

GetEmailIdentity.document: This API is used to get the configuration details of a sender domain.
GetEmailIdentity.name: Gets the configuration details of a sender domain

GetEmailTemplate.document: This API is used to get the details of a template.
GetEmailTemplate.name: Gets the details of a template

GetSendEmailStatus.document: Search the email sending status. Only support querying data within 30 days.
GetSendEmailStatus.name: Query the email sending status

GetStatisticsReport.document: This API is used to get the email sending statistics over a recent period, including data on sent emails, delivery success rate, open rate, bounce rate, and so on.
GetStatisticsReport.name: Gets email sending statistics

ListAddressUnsubscribeConfig.document: This API is used to get the address and unsubscribe configuration list.
ListAddressUnsubscribeConfig.name: Get address and unsubscribe configuration list

ListBlackEmailAddress.document: The API is used to get blocklisted addresses. In the case of a hard bounce, Tencent Cloud will blocklist the recipient address and do not allow any user to send emails to this address. If you confirm that this is a misjudgment, you can remove it from the blocklist.
ListBlackEmailAddress.name: Gets blocklisted email addresses

ListEmailAddress.document: This API is used to get the list of sender addresses.
ListEmailAddress.name: Gets the list of sender addresses

ListEmailIdentities.document: This API is used to get the list of sender domains, including verified and unverified domains.
ListEmailIdentities.name: Gets the list of sender domains

ListEmailTemplates.document: This API is used to get the list of email templates.
ListEmailTemplates.name: Gets the list of email templates

ListReceiverDetails.document: Query ALL recipient email addresses in the recipient list based on the recipient list id with paging query. Filter queries can be based on the recipient email address.
ListReceiverDetails.name: Query a certain recipient list detail

ListReceivers.document: This API is used to query recipient groups. It supports pagination, fuzzy query, and query by status.
ListReceivers.name: Queries recipient groups

ListSendTasks.document: This API is used to query batch email sending tasks (including immediate, scheduled, and recurring tasks) by page. You can query task data including the number of emails requested to be sent, the number of sent emails, the number of cached emails, and task status.
ListSendTasks.name: Queries email sending tasks

SendEmail.document: This API is used to send an HTML or TEXT email triggered for authentication or transaction. By default, you can send emails using a template only.
SendEmail.name: Sends an email

UpdateAddressUnsubscribeConfig.document: This API is used to update address-level unsubscribe configurations.
UpdateAddressUnsubscribeConfig.name: Update address and unsubscribe configuration

UpdateEmailIdentity.document: This API is used to verify whether your DNS configuration is correct.
UpdateEmailIdentity.name: Verifies DNS configuration

UpdateEmailSmtpPassWord.document: This API is used to set the SMTP password. Initially, no SMTP password is set for your email address, so emails cannot be sent over SMTP. To send emails over SMTP, you must set the SMTP password. The set password can be changed subsequently.
UpdateEmailSmtpPassWord.name: Sets the SMTP password

UpdateEmailTemplate.document: This API is used to update an email template. An updated template must be approved again before it can be used.
UpdateEmailTemplate.name: Updates an email template

members.document: Unsubscription link option 0: do not include unsubscription link 1: simplified chinese 2: english 3: traditional chinese 4: spanish 5: french 6: german 7: japanese 8: korean 9: arabic 10: thai.

members.document:
For variable parameters in template, please use json.dump to format the json object into string type. the object is a set of Key-value pairs. each Key represents a variable in template. variable usage in template is represented by {{Key}}. the appropriate value will be replaced with {{value}} when sent.
Note: the parameter value cannot be data of complex type such as html. the entire JSON structure of TemplateData has a length limit of 800 bytes.
members.name: TemplateData

members.document: Sender'S email address. when not using an alias, enter the sender's email address directly, for example: noreply@mail.qcloud.com. to enter a sender alias, follow this format (note that a space must separate the alias and email address): alias+space+<email address>. the alias cannot contain a colon (:).
members.name: FromEmailAddress

members.document: Recipient email address, supports up to 50 recipients in mass sending. note: the email content displays all recipient addresses. for non-mass sending, call the API multiple times to send.
members.name: Destination

members.document: The "reply" email address of the mail. can be filled with an email address where you can receive mail, which can be a personal mailbox. if left empty, the recipient's reply mail will fail to send.
members.name: ReplyToAddresses

members.document: Cc recipient email address, supports up to 20 carbon copies.
members.name: Cc

members.document: Bcc email address, supports up to 20 carbon copies. Bcc and Destination must be unique.
members.name: Bcc

Use template for sending and fill in related parameters.

members.name: Attachments

members.name: TriggerType

members.name: RequestId

members.document: The `MessageId` field returned by the `SendEmail` API
members.name: MessageId

members.document:
Tencent Cloud processing status
0: Successful.
1001: Internal system exception.
1002: Internal system exception.
1003: Internal system exception.
1003: Internal system exception.
1004: Email sending timed out.
1005: Internal system exception.
1006: You have sent too many emails to the same address in a short period.
1007: The email address is in the blocklist.
1008: The sender domain is rejected by the recipient.
1009: Internal system exception.
1010: The daily email sending limit is exceeded.
1011: You have no permission to send custom content. Use a template.
1013: The sender domain is unsubscribed from by the recipient.
2001: No results were found.
3007: The template ID is invalid or the template is unavailable.
3008: The sender domain is temporarily blocked by the recipient domain.
3009: You have no permission to use this template.
3010: The format of the `TemplateData` field is incorrect. 
3014: The email cannot be sent because the sender domain is not verified.
3020: The recipient email address is in the blocklist.
3024: Failed to precheck the email address format.
3030: Email sending is restricted temporarily due to a high bounce rate.
3033: The account has insufficient balance or overdue payment.
members.name: SendStatus

members.document:
Recipient processing status
0: Tencent Cloud has accepted the request and added it to the send queue.
1: The email is delivered successfully. `DeliverTime` indicates the time when the email is delivered successfully.
2: The email is discarded. `DeliverMessage` indicates the reason for discarding.
3: The recipient's ESP rejects the email, probably because the email address does not exist or due to other reasons.
8: The email is delayed by the ESP. `DeliverMessage` indicates the reason for delay.
members.name: DeliverStatus

members.document: Description of the recipient processing status
members.name: DeliverMessage

members.document: Timestamp when the request arrives at Tencent Cloud
members.name: RequestTime

members.document: Timestamp when Tencent Cloud delivers the email
members.name: DeliverTime

members.document: Whether the recipient has opened the email
members.name: UserOpened

members.document: Whether the recipient has clicked the links in the email
members.name: UserClicked

members.document: Whether the recipient has unsubscribed from the email sent by the sender
members.name: UserUnsubscribed

members.document: Whether the recipient has reported the sender
members.name: UserComplainted

members.document: Whether the user reports the sender.
members.name: UserComplained

members.document: Task status. `1`: to start; `5`: sending; `6`: sending suspended today; `7`: sending error; `10`: sent
members.name: TaskStatus

members.document: Number of emails requested to be sent
members.name: RequestCount

members.document:
Parameters of a recurring task
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value can be found.
members.name: CycleParam

members.document:
Parameters of a scheduled task
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value can be found.
members.name: TimedParam

Simple.document: Email content, which can be plain text (TEXT), pure code (HTML), or a combination of TEXT and HTML (recommended).

members.document: HTML code after base64 encoding. To ensure correct display, this parameter should include all code information and cannot contain external CSS.
members.name: Html

members.document: Plain text content after base64 encoding. If HTML is not involved, the plain text will be displayed in the email. Otherwise, this parameter represents the plain text style of the email.
members.name: Text

Template.document: Template information, including template ID, template variable parameters, etc.

members.document: Template ID. If you don’t have any template, please create one.
members.name: TemplateID
TemplateData

TemplateContent.document: Template content, which must include at least one of TEXT and HTML. A combination of TEXT and HTML is recommended.

members.document: Template status. 1: under review; 0: approved; 2: rejected; other values: unavailable.
members.name: TemplateStatus

members.example: 禁止发送未经收件人许可的电子邮件。
members.name: ReviewReason

TimedEmailParam.document: Time parameter required to create a scheduled sending task, such as the start time

members.document: Start time of a scheduled sending task
members.name: BeginTime

members.document: Unsubscribe link option. 0: Do not add unsubscribe link; 1: English 2: Simplified Chinese; 3: Traditional Chinese; 4: Spanish; 5: French; 6: German; 7: Japanese; 8: Korean; 9: Arabic; 10: Thai
members.name: UnsubscribeConfig

members.document: The unique request ID, generated by the server, will be returned for every request (if the request fails to reach the server for other reasons, the request will not obtain a RequestId). RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.name: Id

members.document: Expiration time. if left empty, it indicates permanent validity.
members.name: ExpireDate
